title: Talking About Dreams and Hypothetical Situations
description: Practice discussing dreams, giving advice, and talking about imaginary scenarios.

sentences.text: If I could travel anywhere in the world, I would go to New Zealand.
sentences.translation: 세계 어디든 여행할 수 있다면 뉴질랜드에 갈 거예요.

sentences.text: If I had more free time, I would learn to play the guitar.
sentences.translation: 자유 시간이 더 있다면 기타 연주를 배울 텐데요.
sentences.tips: 'had'로 현재 가지고 있지 않은 것을 표현하세요.

sentences.text: If I were you, I would take that job opportunity.
sentences.translation: 내가 너라면 그 일자리 기회를 잡을 거야.

sentences.text: What would you do if you won the lottery?
If I could change one thing about my life, I would spend more time with my family.
sentences.translation: 내 삶에서 한 가지를 바꿀 수 있다면 가족과 더 많은 시간을 보낼 거예요.

sentences.text: I would move to another country if I spoke the language fluently.
sentences.translation: 그 언어를 유창하게 한다면 다른 나라로 이사할 텐데요.

sentences.text: If money weren't an issue, I would study art full-time.
sentences.translation: 돈이 문제가 아니라면 미술을 전일제로 공부할 텐데요.

sentences.text: She could achieve her dream if she believed in herself more.
sentences.translation: 자신을 더 믿는다면 그녀는 꿈을 이룰 수 있을 텐데요.

sentences.text: If I didn't have to work, I would volunteer at an animal shelter.
sentences.translation: 일을 안 해도 된다면 동물 보호소에서 봉사할 텐데요.

sentences.text: Would you still work if you became very wealthy?
I would regret it if I didn't at least try to pursue my dream.
sentences.translation: 최소한 꿈을 추구하려고 시도하지 않으면 후회할 거예요.

sentences.text: If I could give my younger self advice, I would tell myself not to worry so much.
sentences.translation: 어린 시절의 나에게 조언을 줄 수 있다면 걱정을 너무 많이 하지 말라고 할 거예요.
sentences.tips: 가상의 과거 상황에 대한 조언을 표현하세요.

lines.text: Tyler, if you could have any job in the world, what would it be?
That's a fun question. If I could do anything, I think I would be a wildlife documentary filmmaker.
I love nature, and if I had that job, I could travel to remote places and show people the beauty of wildlife.
That's a wonderful dream. What's stopping you?
Well, it's not very practical. If I quit my current job, I wouldn't have a stable income.
If I were you, I would start making nature videos as a hobby first.
That's actually a great idea. What about you? What would you do if you could do anything?
If I had unlimited time and money, I would open a bakery. I love baking.
You should! Your cookies are delicious. If you started a bakery, I would be your first customer!

items: Did you pronounce 'would' and contractions correctly?
Did you use appropriate stress on key words?
Did you use rising intonation for questions?
Did you speak at a natural pace?
Did you use second conditional structures smoothly?
Did you transition naturally between if-clauses and main clauses?
Did you complete sentences without long pauses?
Did you practice the dialogue naturally?
Did you use past simple in the if-clause?
Did you use 'would/could/might' in the main clause?
Did you use 'were' correctly for advice ('If I were you')?
Did you express dreams and wishes clearly?
Did you discuss hypothetical situations naturally?
Did you engage naturally in the dialogue?
